summary: Since 2008, fires on Navy ships that were undergoing maintenance have caused more than $4 billion in damages—and the loss of two ships. Maintenance repairs on ships can cause sparks in confined areas, leaving them at high risk of fire. The Navy has worked to improve fire safety, but we found that lessons learned from fires aren't being shared consistently across the service. And while...
title: Navy Ship Fires: Ongoing Efforts to Improve Safety Should Be Enhanced
